channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Accelerated Eng/Sci + MBA Virtual Info Session Scheduled for October 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - Register to attend this session to learn more about the Accelerated Engineering/Science + MBA Program, which allows Rensselaer engineering and science undergraduates to complete their Bachelor’s degree within eight or fewer semesters with the option to receive an award of up to 50% of their tuition charges during their additional semesters of MBA graduate study.
item.author: Students

item.title: Second Game Jam to be Held October 25
item.description: RPI’s Game Dev Club is hosting its second Game Jam of the year starting on Friday, October 25 at 5pm in Sage Labs, VAST & 2411! Please join us once again (or for the first time!) for a 48-hour jam (with overnight breaks beginning at 10:00 PM both Friday and Saturday nights with doors opening again at 8:00 AM each morning). Teams will be formed to design their own game from scratch. Students of all years, areas of study, and experience levels are welcome to participate!
item.author: Students

item.title: Livestream Viewing of Ketanji Brown Jackson Leadership Presentation to be Held October 22
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 7:00 PM - 8:00 PM - The National Society of Leadership and Success’ Speaker Broadcast Series is holding this livestream “Supreme Insights” event featuring Supreme Court Justice Ketanji Brown Jackson. Attend to discover the principles of leadership, fairness and the responsibilities that come with holding one of the most significant roles in the judiciary.
item.author: Students

item.title: “Coffee & Art” Sessions Continue October 22
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 12:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Come to the Mueller Center lobby for this creative and social event, which gives students a chance enjoy a variety of coffee options while participating in different arts-and-crafts activities in a relaxed atmosphere. Stop by to unwind, connect with peers, and engage in creative hands-on projects!
item.author: Students

item.title: ITWS Co-Terminal Program Info Sessions Continue October 22
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 22, 2024 4:00 PM - 5:00 PM - Attend this session to learn about the Information Technology & Web Science co-terminal program as Dr. Brian Callahan discusses program requirements, the application process, and upcoming deadlines, and also answers questions. This info session is geared toward first- and second-semester seniors, but all students are welcome to attend.
item.author: Students

item.title: OGE Online Workshop to Offer Tips for Dissertation, Thesis Preparation and Submission
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM - This workshop will discuss the basics of correct thesis organization and format, appropriate paper attribution and reference citation styles, and review the most common mistakes and ways to avoid them. All students who will be writing a thesis or dissertation are welcome to register and get their questions ready!
item.author: Students

item.title: Don’t Miss the RPI 2024 Graduate School Expo!
item.description: Join the Center for Career and Professional Development for the RPI 2024 Graduate School Expo, scheduled to be held in the Heffner Alumni House from 1PM to 4PM on October 23! Students will have opportunities to interact directly with various graduate schools and learn more about their programs; register in Handshake to view the participating schools.
item.author: Students

item.title: EHS Shares Fire Safety Tips and Offers Fire Extinguisher Training
item.description: In support of National Fire Protection Association’s (NFPA) 2024 Fire Prevention Week, Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) has gathered key safety reminders about smoke detectors. EHS will also be offering hands-on fire extinguisher training at 41 Ninth Street on October 23, October 29 and November 12, so be sure to sign up in advance in Percipio!
item.author: Community

item.title: “I Dream” to Offer Powerful Tribute to the Civil Rights Movement
item.description: In partnership with Rensselaer, the Musical Dramatic Arts Foundation is proud to present a concert version of the groundbreaking musical “I Dream.” The special performance, which will take place in the EMPAC Theater on November, aims to reach both the broader community as well as Rensselaer students, faculty and staff.
item.author: Community

item.title: United Way to Hold Election Day Barbeque Fund Raiser
item.description: Date: Tuesday, November 5, 2024 2:30 PM - 5:30 PM - In conjunction with Sodexho, the Rensselaer United Way Campaign will hold an Election Day chicken barbeque fund raiser, featuring your choice of a full takeout-only meal for only $16! Please contact any of the United Way committee members to purchase your dinner(s) and also let them know what time you will pick up your food at EMPAC. Dinners must be paid in advance by cash, or with a check made to Rensselaer, by noon Tuesday, October 29.
item.author: Community

item.title: “Becoming Unsettled through Intersensory Listening” Topic of October 23 Lecture
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 2:30 PM - 4:00 PM - In this lecture, Dr. Ellen Waterman will reflect on the development of inter-sensory approaches to listening, drawing on the insights of collaborators who model “listening otherwise,” and will share transformational collaborations with deaf musicians to develop an instructional score for inter-sensory improvisation and a film of signed music. The talk will be followed by open discussion and Q&A.
item.author: Community

item.title: MSE Seminar Series to Continue October 23
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 23, 2024 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM - This seminar will feature a presentation titled “Time Domain Views of 2D van der Waals Quantum Matter,” by speaker Dr. Xiaoyang Zhu, a Professor of Nanoscience at Columbia University.
item.author: Community

item.title: Capital Region AI Plus Symposium Scheduled for October 22
item.description: Register to join the Future of Computing Institute at Rensselaer on October 22 for the Capital Region AI Plus Symposium, a joint effort by RPI and UAlbany that will bring together thought leaders, innovators, and professionals from across the Capital Region and New York State to discuss the impact and future of AI.
item.author: Community

item.title: 2024 Pillar of Rensselaer Nominations Now Open
item.description: Nominations are currently being accepted for the 2024 Pillars Award, which is the highest and most prestigious award Rensselaer presents to a long-term member of the staff. Please view the list of eligible nominees and then use the available form to submit your nominations by Friday, November 8!…

item.title: Commons, RSDH Offering Faculty/Staff Lunch Special October 23
item.description:
For October Faculty/Staff Appreciation Day, Auxiliary Services welcomes Rensselaer faculty and staff to enjoy a $5.00 lunch special at the Commons and Russell Sage Dining Halls on Wednesday, October 23.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
